data.title: Honors Performance Series

data.text:
A Life-Changing Experience

The world’s renowned stages demand the world’s best performers. The Honors Performance Series assembles some of the world’s rising young musicians to perform under the baton of master conductors at several of the world’s most celebrated concert halls: Carnegie Hall in New York City, USA; Ambassador Auditorium in Los Angles, USA; Sydney Opera House in Sydney, Australia; Royal Festival Hall at Southbank Centre in London, England; and the Musikverein in Vienna, Austria.

The Honors Performance Series was established to feature talented young musicians on stage at one of the world's most famous music halls: Carnegie Hall.

Selected performers come together in New York City for several days of rehearsals with renowned conductors leading up to their life-changing performance at Carnegie Hall's Stern Auditorium / Perelman Stage. In addition to performance preparation, networking with peers and experiencing the sights and performance arts of New York City are also important parts of the experience.

In the footsteps of the renowned Honors Performance Series at Carnegie Hall, we are pleased to have featured young musicians on these additional world-class stages:

Musikverein

Vienna, Austria

Ambassador Auditorium

California, USA

Royal Festival Hall at Southbank Centre

London, England

image © Christian Bortes

https://www.flickr.com/photos/79653482@N00/7251199192

Sydney Opera House

Sydney, Australia

Meet Our Conductors

Our annually rotating group of distinguished Conductors has included Eph Ehly, Charles Peltz, H. Robert Reynolds, and others (see below for an inclusive list).

Dr. Jeffery L. Ames

Dr. Jeffery L. Ames Conductor, 2024, 2022, 2016 and 2012 High School Honors Concert Choir (Carnegie Hall); 2023 and 2014 Middle School Honors Junior Choir (Carnegie Hall); 2022 High School Honors Choir (Musikverein); 2020 Young Adult Honors Choir (Carnegie Hall); 2017 High School Honors Choir (Sydney Opera House) Dr. Jeffery L. Ames is a distinguished…

Sandra Babb Conductor, 2024 Middle School Honors Junior Concert Choir (Ambassador Auditorium) Sandra Babb is Associate Professor of Choral Music Education at Oregon State University, where she teaches and conducts the Soprano-Alto choir, OSU Bella Voce, and has performed for state, region, and national conferences of the American Choral Directors Association and the National Association…

Catherine Birke

Catherine Birke Conductor, 2024 High School Honors String Orchestra (Carnegie Hall) Catherine Birke is an energetic and passionate conductor and educator. She is the Music Director of the Music Advancement Program (MAP) at The Juilliard School, the Music Director of the Metropolitan Youth Orchestra (MYO) Nassau Symphony Orchestra, and the Director of Orchestras at Herricks…

Matthew Brady Conductor, 2024 High School Honors Treble Choir (Carnegie Hall) Matthew Brady is an American conductor and tenor. He is currently serving on the faculty at the Frost School of Music at the University of Miami. There he conducts Symphonic Choir and Bella Voce, and teaches courses at the undergraduate and graduate levels. In…

“This was my first Honors Performance, and it makes me want to audition for everything now - so maybe I can experience something half as incredible.”
